comments.body:
1. what happens with existing semicolons?
2. why aren't there semicolons here in the original source? are you modelling erroneous code?
3. if so, can you add

```ts
;['three'] = {}
;['four']
```

to show what happens there?

> why aren't there semicolons here in the original source? are you modelling erroneous code?

Valid, but stupidly formatted code. This parses as `["one"] = {}["two"]`, so the test ensures that we don’t insert a semicolon that would change how the input parses.

> if so, can you add

Yeah, sure. I can tell you that the formatter won’t even consider it, as a potential spot for insertion, because it processes pairs of tokens excluding trivia, so it will see a declaration that already ends in a semicolon. But it’s nice to add realistic user code as tests along with these bananas edge cases.

> erroneous code

> stupidly formatted code

You say [tʰəme<sup>ɪ</sup>ɾo<sup>ʊ</sup>], I say [tʰəmato<sup>ʊ</sup>]!
@sandersn This is your test case. The indentation is obviously not ideal, but it’s totally unrelated to anything in this PR :/
